tit.j: 中根龍太郎喜劇プロダクション

sen.j: 中根龍太郎喜劇プロダクション（なかねりゅうたろう きげき-、1928年6月 設立 - 8月 解散）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Nakane Ryutaro Comedy Production, founded in June 1928 and closed in August 1928, was the film company used to be located in Kyoto.
Nakane Ryutaro Comedy Productions, founded in June of 1928 and closed in August of 1928, was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Production > Productions; added "of" after "June" and "August"; fixed grammar
sen.e: Nakane Ryutaro Comedy Productions, founded in June of 1928 and closed in August of 1928, was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 当時の主演俳優で映画監督の中根龍太郎が設立したスタープロダクションであった。
sen.e: It was the production established by Ryutaro NAKANE, a leading actor and a director at the time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処定訳不明→「スタープロダクション」
sen.e: It was a production company established by Ryutaro NAKANE, a leading actor and director of the time.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: It was a production company established by Ryutaro NAKANE, a leading actor and director of the time.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 貸しスタジオの双ヶ丘撮影所で3本のサイレント映画を製作した。
sen.e: The production produced three silent films by borrowing the Narabigaoka Studio.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処定訳不明→「貸しスタジオ」
sen.e: The company produced three silent films by renting the Narabigaoka Studio.
sen.cmt: changed "The production" to "The company"; changed "borrowing" to "renting"
sen.e: The company produced three silent films by renting the Narabigaoka Studio.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 端役時代の榎本健一が出演していることで知られる。
sen.e: They are known as the films in which Kenichi ENOMOTO appeared when he was a bit-part actor.
These films are known for their appearances of Kenichi ENOMOTO while he was a bit-part actor.
sen.cmt: changed "when" to "while"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: These films are known for their appearances of Kenichi ENOMOTO while he was a bit-part actor.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 中根コメディプロダクション（なかね-）ともいい、通称中根プロ。
sen.e: The production is also known as Nakane Comedy Production and commonly known as "Nakane-pro" (Nakane Production).
It is also known as Nakane Comedy Productions and commonly referred to as "Nakane-pro" (Nakane Productions).
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: It is also known as Nakane Comedy Productions and commonly referred to as "Nakane-pro" (Nakane Productions).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）4月、マキノ・プロダクションの四国ブロック配給会社・三共社の山崎徳次郎は、阪東妻三郎プロダクションの経営者・立花良介、神戸市の菊水キネマの大島菊松らとともに、全国150館の独立系映画館主を集めた。
sen.e: In April 1928, Tokujiro YAMAZAKI of Sankyo Company (the distribution company of Makino Production which was conducted its business in the Shikoku region), gathered the owners of 150 independent theaters around Japan with Ryosuke Tachibana (the owner of Bando Tsumasaburo Production), Kikumatsu OSHIMA (Kikusui Kinema Firm in Kobe City), etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処定訳不明→「マキノ・プロダクションの四国ブロック配給会社」※原文の複雑な情報を整理して伝えるため、原文には書かれていない箇所で()を使用しました。
sen.e: In April of 1928, Tokujiro YAMAZAKI of the company called Sankyo (the distribution company of Makino Productions which conducted its business in the Shikoku region), gathered the owners of 150 independent theaters around Japan with Ryosuke Tachibana (the owner of Bando Tsumasaburo Productions), Kikumatsu OSHIMA (Kikusui Kinema Firm in Kobe City) and others.
sen.cmt: changed "Sankyo Company" to "the company called Sankyo"; Production > Productions; changed "etc" to "and others"
sen.e: In April of 1928, Tokujiro YAMAZAKI of the company called Sankyo (the distribution company of Makino Productions which conducted its business in the Shikoku region), gathered the owners of 150 independent theaters around Japan with Ryosuke Tachibana (the owner of Bando Tsumasaburo Productions), Kikumatsu OSHIMA (Kikusui Kinema Firm in Kobe City) and others.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大阪に「日本活動常設館館主連盟映画配給本社」を設立、独立プロダクションへの製作費の出資と作品の直接公開の方針を打ち出す。
sen.e: "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Headquarters of Distribution Company for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) was established in Osaka, announcing the policies of the contribution of the production costs and the direct distribution of the films to the independent productions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処定訳不明 →「日本活動常設館館主連盟映画配給本社」
sen.e: "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) was established in Osaka and announced policies on contributions to production costs and direct distribution of films to independent productions.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha' (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) was established in Osaka and announced policies on contributions to production costs and direct distribution of films to independent productions.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: それを受けた片岡千恵蔵は4月にマキノを退社、5月に「片岡千恵蔵プロダクション」（千恵プロ）を設立、同時期にマキノを退社した嵐寛寿郎、山口俊雄 (映画俳優)、市川小文治、山本礼三郎らもそれぞれプロダクションを設立する。
sen.e: Influenced by this, Chiezo KATAOKA who left the Makino Production in April and found "Kataoka Chiezo Production" (commonly known as Chie Production) in May, and other members who resigned from the Makino Production around the same time, such as Kanjuro ARASHI, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (a movie actor), Kobunji ICHIKAWA, and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO, established their own productions.

Influenced by these announcements, Chiezo KATAOKA, who left Makino Productions in April and found "Kataoka Chiezo Productions" (commonly known as Chie Productions) in May, as well as other members who resigned from Makino Productions around the same time such as Kanjuro ARASHI, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (the film actor), Kobunji ICHIKAWA and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO established their own productions as well.
sen.cmt: changed "this" to "these announcements"; Production > Productions; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Influenced by these announcements, Chiezo KATAOKA, who left Makino Productions in April and found 'Kataoka Chiezo Productions' (commonly known as Chie Productions) in May, as well as other members who resigned from Makino Productions around the same time such as Kanjuro ARASHI, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (the film actor), Kobunji ICHIKAWA and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO established their own productions as well.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: マキノの主演俳優で監督も兼ねていた中根龍太郎もマキノを退社。
sen.e: Ryutaro NAKANE, a leading actor and a director of the Makino Production, also left the company.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The leading actor and director of Makino Productions named Ryutaro NAKANE also left the company.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more smoothly; Production > Productions
sen.e: The leading actor and director of Makino Productions named Ryutaro NAKANE also left the company.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年6月、中根が設立したのがこの「中根龍太郎喜劇プロダクション」である。
sen.e: The production established in June of the same year was the "Nakane Ryutaro Comedy Production."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "Nakane Ryutaro Comedy Productions" was established during June of 1928.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more smoothly; Production > Productions; changed "of the same year" to "of 1928"
sen.e: Nakane Ryutaro Comedy Productions' was established during June of 1928.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: また、山崎に共鳴したマキノの大道具主任河合広始と撮影技師の田中十三もマキノを退社、京都・双ヶ丘に貸しスタジオ「日本キネマ撮影所」（双ヶ丘撮影所）を設立した。
sen.e: Moved by Yamazaki's innovative actions, Hiroshi KAWAI, the chief stagehand of the Makino Production, and a cinematographer, Juzo Tanaka, also left the Makino Production and established the Japan Kinema Studio (also known as Narabigaoka Studio) in Narabigaoka, Kyoto to rent.
sen.cmt: ※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: Moved by Yamazaki's innovative actions, Makino Productions' chief stagehand Hiroshi KAWAI and cinematographer Juzo Tanaka left Makino and established the rentable studio called Japan Kinema Studio (also known as Narabigaoka Studio) in Narabigaoka, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to have less commas and read more smoothly
sen.e: Moved by Yamazaki's innovative actions, Makino Productions' chief stagehand Hiroshi KAWAI and cinematographer Juzo Tanaka left Makino and established the rentable studio called 'Japan Kinema Studio' (also known as Narabigaoka Studio) in Narabigaoka, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 千恵プロ以下そろって「日本映画プロダクション連盟」を結成した。
sen.e: "Japan Movie Production Federation" was organized by the people who established their own productions after leaving the Makino Production, including Chie Production.
sen.cmt: ※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: "Japan Movie Production Federation" was organized by those who established their own productions after leaving Makino, including Chie Productions.
sen.cmt: eliminated "Production" after "Makino"; Production > Productions; changed "the people" to "those";
sen.e: Japan Movie Production Federation' was organized by those who established their own productions after leaving Makino, including Chie Productions.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: この河合・田中の「双ヶ丘撮影所」をレンタル使用して、「館主連盟」に作品の供給を開始する。
sen.e: They borrowed the "Narabigaoka Studio" established by Kawai and Tanaka to take their movies and started to provide their movies to the Theater Owner's Association.
sen.cmt: ※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: They borrowed "Narabigaoka Studio," established by Kawai and Tanaka, to make films and began providing movies to the Theater Owner's Association.
sen.cmt: eliminated "the" after "borrowed"; added comma after "Studio" and "Tanaka"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: They borrowed 'Narabigaoka Studio,' established by Kawai and Tanaka, to make films and began providing movies to the 'Theater Owner's Association.'
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 中根プロには、松竹京都撮影所の名物照明マンだった「ムタやん」こと牟田口茂（のちの有馬是馬）が俳優に転向、「有馬茂明」を名乗り、浅草オペラのコーラスボーイ崩れで東亜キネマ京都撮影所（等持院撮影所）の大部屋俳優だった榎本健一（当時「榎本健」名義）を連れて参加した。
sen.e: To the Nakane Production, Shigeru MUTAGUCHI, known for his nickname "Mutayan," (later known as Korema ARIMA), a famous lighting technician in the Shochiku Kyoto Studio, joined as the actor identifying himself as "Shigeaki ARIMA," bringing Kenichi Enomoto (announced himself "Ken ENOMOTO" at the time) who was a chorus boy for Asakusa Opera and a Obeya-haiyu (an actor who played a bit-part to establish his/her career, living together with other actors who had the same aims) of the Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio (also known as Toji-in Studio).
sen.cmt: 定訳不明→「浅草オペラ」、「大部屋俳優」
sen.e: A famous lighting technician who worked at the Shochiku Kyoto Studio named Shigeru MUTAGUCHI, known for his nickname "Mutayan" (later known as Korema ARIMA), joined Nakane Productions under the name "Shigeaki ARIMA," bringing over Kenichi Enomoto (he referred to himself as "Ken ENOMOTO" at the time), a chorus boy for the Asakusa Opera and Obeya-haiyu (an actor who played bit-parts to establish their career and lived together with other actors who had the same aims) from Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio (also known as Toji-in Studio).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: A famous lighting technician who worked at the Shochiku Kyoto Studio named Shigeru MUTAGUCHI, known for his nickname 'Mutayan' (later known as Korema ARIMA), joined Nakane Productions under the name 'Shigeaki ARIMA,' bringing over Kenichi Enomoto (he referred to himself as 'Ken ENOMOTO' at the time), a chorus boy for the Asakusa Opera and Obeya-haiyu (an actor who played bit-parts to establish their career and lived together with other actors who had the same aims) from Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio (also known as Toji-in Studio).
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: また、のちに映画監督小崎政房であり剣戟俳優・松山宗三郎となる前の結城三重吉、のちに大乗寺八郎となる前の千葉三郎も参加した。
sen.e: Miekichi YUKI (later known as the director, Masafusa OZAKI, and the Kengeki actor [a Swashbuckler film actor], Shuzaburo MATSUYAMA) and Saburo CHIBA (later known as Hachiro DAIJOJI) also joined the Nakane Production.
sen.cmt: ※原文の複雑な情報を整理して伝えるため、原文には記載されていない箇所で()を使用しました。
sen.e: Miekichi YUKI (later known as the director Masafusa OZAKI and Kengeki actor [a Swashbuckler film actor], Shuzaburo MATSUYAMA) and Saburo CHIBA (later known as Hachiro DAIJOJI) also joined Nakane Productions.
sen.cmt: the Nakane Production > Nakane Productions; eliminated comma after "director" and "OZAKI";
sen.e: Miekichi YUKI (later known as the director Masafusa OZAKI and Kengeki actor [a Swashbuckler film actor], Shuzaburo MATSUYAMA) and Saburo CHIBA (later known as Hachiro DAIJOJI) also joined Nakane Productions.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 設立第1作『助太刀商売』には市川小文治歌舞伎映画プロダクションの市川小文治も出演している。
sen.e: Kobunji ICHIKAWA of Ichikawa Kobunji Kabuki Eiga Production also performed in the first work, "Sukedachi Shobai" (Business of Helping to Kill Somebody), which was produced after the Nakane Production was established.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明→『助太刀商売』※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: Kobunji ICHIKAWA of Ichikawa Kobunji Kabuki Eiga Productions also performed in the first work, "Sukedachi Shobai" (Business of Helping to Kill Somebody), produced after Nakane Productions was established.
sen.cmt: Production > Productions; eliminated "the" before "Nakane"; eliminated "which was" before "produced";
sen.e: Kobunji ICHIKAWA of Ichikawa Kobunji Kabuki Eiga Productions also performed in the first work, "Sukedachi Shobai" (Business of Helping to Kill Somebody), produced after Nakane Productions was established.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、7月末に早くも山崎らの「館主連盟」が瓦解する。
sen.e: However, the Theater Owner's Association established by Yamazaki and others collapsed as early as the end of July.
However, the Theater Owner's Association established by Yamazaki and others had already collapsed by the end of July.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar
sen.e: However, the Theater Owner's Association established by Yamazaki and others had already collapsed by the end of July.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同時に独立したプロダクションたちとともに、中根プロは3本の喜劇映画を撮って、8月には解散した。
sen.e: The Nakane Production was closed down in August after they took three comedy movies with the other independent productions which started their businesses around the same time.
Nakane Productions was closed down in August after shooting three comedy films along with the other independent productions that had started their businesses around the same time.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar
sen.e: Nakane Productions was closed down in August after shooting three comedy films along with the other independent productions that had started their businesses around the same time.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 千恵プロのみが年内に6本の映画を製作、翌年には嵯峨野に自前の撮影所を建設した。
sen.e: Only Chie Production produced six movies in the year and built their own studio in Sagano next year.
Only Chie Productions produced six movies that year and built their own studio in Sagano the following year.
sen.cmt: Production > Productions; next year > the following year
sen.e: Only Chie Productions produced six movies that year and built their own studio in Sagano the following year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 解散後の中根は、有馬や小崎とともに、妻の女優泉春子の実家を頼って佐賀県唐津町（現在の唐津市）へと流れ、浪花節芝居の一座に入った。
sen.e: After the production was closed down, Nakane stayed at the parents home of his wife (an actress, Haruko IZUMI) in Karatsu-cho, Saga Prefecture (present-day Karatsu City) with Arima and Ozaki and joined the troupe of Hanabushi Shibai (Hanabushi Play).
sen.cmt: 定訳不明→「浪花節芝居の一座」※原文の複雑な情報を整理して伝えるため、原文には記載されていない箇所で()を使用しました。
sen.e: After the production was closed down, Nakane stayed at his wife's parents' home (the actress, Haruko IZUMI) in Karatsu-cho, Saga Prefecture (present-day Karatsu City) with Arima and Ozaki and joined the Hanabushi Shibai (Hanabushi Play) troupe.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: After the production was closed down, Nakane stayed at his wife's parents' home (the actress, Haruko IZUMI) in Karatsu-cho, Saga Prefecture (present-day Karatsu City) with Arima and Ozaki and joined the Hanabushi Shibai (Hanabushi Play) troupe.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: やがて中根は11月に松竹京都撮影所に迎えられた。
sen.e: Before long Nakane was welcomed into the Shochiku Kyoto Studio in November.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Before long Nakane was welcomed into the Shochiku Kyoto Studio in November.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Before long Nakane was welcomed into the Shochiku Kyoto Studio in November.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 中根の推薦で有馬と小崎、千葉（大乗寺）も同撮影所に入社した。
sen.e: Arima, Ozaki and Chiba (later known as Daijoji) also joined the studio by the recommendation of Nakane.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Arima, Ozaki and Chiba (later known as Daijoji) also joined the studio through Nakane's recommendation.
sen.cmt: by the recommendation of Nakane > through Nakane's recommendation
sen.e: Arima, Ozaki and Chiba (later known as Daijoji) also joined the studio through Nakane's recommendation.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「コメディ」に目醒めた榎本は翌1929年（昭和4年）に古巣の浅草公園六区に戻った。
sen.e: Enomoto who came to realize the art of comedy returned to Asakusa-koen Roku-ku (Asakusa Park District No. 6) in 1929.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: Enomoto came to realize the art of comedy and returned to Asakusa-koen Roku-ku (Asakusa Park District No. 6) in 1929.
sen.cmt: eliminated "who"; added "and" after "comedy"
sen.e: Enomoto came to realize the art of 'comedy' and returned to Asakusa-koen Roku-ku (Asakusa Park District No. 6) in 1929.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 「カジノ・フォーリー」、二村定一との「ピエル・ブリリアント」等のコメディ劇団を興し、ブレイクしてゆく。
sen.e: Tried to widen his field, he joined the troupe, Casino Folies, and started the comedy troupe, "Pierre Brilliant" with Teiichi FUTAMURA; and thus he gradually became popular.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: In an attempt to widen his field, he joined the Casino Folies troupe and then started the comedy troupe called "Pierre Brilliant" with Teiichi FUTAMURA and gradually became popular.
sen.cmt: Tried to widen his field > In an attempt to widen his field; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: In an attempt to widen his field, he joined the 'Casino Folies' troupe and then started the comedy troupe called 'Pierre Brilliant' with Teiichi FUTAMURA and gradually became popular.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。
